instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message:
i have this board wich boots up with high fan spin and shuts down. after inspecting it i can see someone else has worked on it due to the bios chip being badly soldered. im wondering if they replaced the bios chip without any knowledge of reprogramming that needs to be done?

is it possible to correctly program the chip without the original bios chip at hand?

assuming thats even the issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message: First try a dump from another board or from the net. It should at least turn on with a BIOS that is good.Once it works we can fix the ME and serial number stuff.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message: Im new to this bios stuff can you link me to a duke approved  bios dumper/flasher? ???

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message: TL866 on Ebay.

No Title

so i got my tl866 II plus in but as im sure you expected i have no idea how to use it or what attachment to use. any good guides out there? i tried using the clamp but i get errors its not reading the chip possibly wrong attachment or not making contact.

threads.message: you need to desolder the chip and use an adapter to read it....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message:
"First try a dump from another board or from the net. It should at least turn on with a BIOS that is good."
Did you do that?

If doesn't work, recharge backup, board has other problem, not BIOS...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message:
It did turn on and booted to OS but it was slow. Since the bios chip looked badly soldered im assuming it was changed.

update: just noticed on about mac it says its a 11inch macbook this is a 13 inch so for sure someone swapped the bios chip. Can i reprogram this one or should i get the correct bios chip from a similar board?

update 2: so i found the correct bios dump online for this board i also found an easy clean me.exe online and using the me region repository for my version of me region (figured out by using me analyzer) I ran the easy clean me.exe on the bin found online. Then using a hex editor i edited the serial number and the secondary board number thats on a sticker and starts with c222 reflashed it onto the bios chip and its still slow. Maybe the easycleanme.exe didnt do its job? I know im supposed to use the fict tool but i have had no luck finding it. Any tips?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)

threads.message:
Asd gave me a 4SNS/C0000008:Ts0P--124 error.
did some research and it is related to trackpad sensor?
i had nothing but the 2 usb ports hooked up and wifi card and display port.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message: Do I really need to tell you the trackpad needs to be connected?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message: Yes, error is related to trackpad not being connected or is it slow because theres no trackpad connected?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but shuts off (Bad Bios)
threads.message: Yes....lmao the trackpad sensor is ON the trackpad so plug it in and try again lol

threads.message: IO board/flatcable.
